<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/the-evergrande-crisis-reflects-greater-rot-in-china-s-real-estate-sector?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
China's Grande Real Estate Problems
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/the-evergrande-crisis-reflects-greater-rot-in-china-s-real-estate-sector?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Apartment building " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/11ece882e08206be2409b55feae994b3c621a941-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The business world has been captivated by the slow-moving train wreck that is Evergrande, a massive Chinese real estate developer that’s buried up to its penthouse in debt. Investors have feared that because of Evergrande’s size and interconnectedness with other companies, its impending collapse could do its best Covid impression and spread contagion across markets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The latest: </strong>Evergrande was able to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-evergrande-inches-close-default-deadline-investors-wait-2021-09-21/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">make an interest payment</a> on a domestic bond yesterday, but the bigger question is whether it’ll be able to settle a $83.5 million bill due today. If it can’t pay up in 30 days, it could default, which might cascade across the global economy.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why is it a big deal?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because in China, real estate is the biggest game in town, and the town is pretty big—China is the world’s second-largest economy. In China, real estate contributes a mind-boggling <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/ea1b79bf-cbe3-41d9-91da-0a1ba692309f?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">29% of GDP</a> (compared to 6.2% in the US in 2018). Building has literally built China into the superpower it is today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But thanks to super-low borrowing costs, the Chinese property sector has been feasting on empty calories, leading to astronomical debt loads ($300+ billion, in the case of Evergrande) and a chronic oversupply of housing.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>There is enough empty property in China to house more than 90 million people, according to the Rhodium Group’s Logan Wright. The entire population of France, Germany, Italy, the UK, or Canada could easily fit into those empty apartments.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gn1egrjMoD8" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">viral video</a></span><span> from last month shows 15 unfinished high-rise apartment buildings getting demolished in a matter of seconds.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like an angry parent whose credit card was abused by their teenager, China’s government has recently <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/c1144ffe-30f9-41d3-b033-bb82eca258b4?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">taken steps</a> to limit the amount of debt that property developers can take on. Letting Evergrande implode would show that President Xi Jinping is serious about this crackdown.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Some observers have compared Evergrande’s woes to the epic collapse of the investment bank Lehman Brothers during the 2008 financial crisis. But <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/0bf52d39-fd42-408f-aa85-52a4135de312?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">other experts</a> say this isn’t a Lehman Brothers moment—it could be worse, if you view China’s gargantuan real estate sector as rotten to the core.<em>—NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/robinhood-to-roll-out-crypto-wallets-for-users?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Crypto Wallets Enter the Mainstream
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/robinhood-to-roll-out-crypto-wallets-for-users?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Phone with card holder wallet on back with crypto symbol" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/644948e7b6de685ab3d438f995529079594e7a3f-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We celebrated the first day of fall with six gallons of chili for dinner; Robinhood celebrated by <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/22/robinhood-to-launch-cryptocurrency-wallets-as-bitcoin-becomes-bigger-part-of-business.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announcing</a> the rollout of a crypto wallet. The wallet will be available for a small test group in the next few weeks, and then to the rest of its users next year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is a crypto wallet?</strong> Just like regular wallets store dollars, crypto wallets are where you store your cryptocurrency. They make it possible to spend crypto like other forms of money and buy things like NFTs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Can’t you buy crypto on Robinhood already? </strong>Kinda, in the sense that you can <em>buy </em>some cryptocurrencies, like bitcoin and ethereum, but you <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/22/22686377/robinhood-crypto-wallet-currency-bitcoin-ethereum?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don’t <em>own </em>them</a>. When you buy crypto on Robinhood, the company buys it and then stores it in its own wallet—which means users can’t transfer it out of the app to spend on their favorite CryptoPunk. Hardcore crypto people have complained that this defeats the entire purpose of crypto<em>currency.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Robinhood’s going full laser eyes. In its latest <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/18/robinhood-extends-relationship-individual-traders-using-says-platform?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earnings report</a>, the company said crypto made up over half of its transaction-based Q2 revenue. While there are still some limitations to its wallet, Robinhood is building the bridge for the crypto-curious into the deeper ecosystem.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/netflix-acquires-roald-dahl-s-complete-works?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Netflix Buying More Content Like
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/netflix-acquires-roald-dahl-s-complete-works?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Matilda turning on lights" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f77b7df339e42378452e99853b3112ac42d6a911-480x342.gif?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Netflix has acquired the rights to all of Roald Dahl’s works, including <em>Matilda</em>, <em>Charlie and the Chocolate Factory</em>, and other tales that kept you up at night as a kid (remember “the Chokey”?). Reportedly <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/c2067f6f-1e39-4dc1-9ef3-9daf82c4c416?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ringing in</a> at over $680 million, it’s among the biggest acquisitions Netflix has made over the past decade.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The deal expands on a 2018 partnership Netflix made for 16 Dahl licenses, which allowed it to start working on several animated series, plus a <em>Matilda the Musical</em> adaptation. Now, Netflix’s ambitions for Dahl’s stories are bigger than the Giant Peach and include games, live theater, products, and more.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Less than a year ago, the Dahl estate publicly apologized for antisemitic comments the author made. To make amends, part of this sale’s proceeds will create a charitable fund focused on “children’s health, anti-hate, and anti-racism.”</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The competition to chill with you is fierce. Netflix is still the largest streaming service in the world with 209 million subscribers, but competitors are <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/22/netflix-buys-roald-dahl-catalog.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">catching up</a>—especially Disney+, which launched less than two years ago but already has 116 million subscribers. Dahl’s trove of kids content could help Netflix keep its edge over Disney...and all the other streamers beefing up their catalogs.—<em>JW</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As an investor, you can take your portfolio in a number of different directions—why not choose a path that goes for green in more ways than one?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s the goal of the <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N805.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25066716.302486328;dc_trk_aid=506247704;dc_trk_cid=157841727;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fidelity Climate Action Fund</a>. It enables investors to support companies that either <strong style="color:#000">prioritize, remove, reduce, or mitigate the effects of climate change.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a fund that aims to create an environmentally focused and balanced strategy with <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N805.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25066716.302486328;dc_trk_aid=506247704;dc_trk_cid=157841727;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">long-term growth potential</a>. <ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In the next decade, the US utility industry’s capacity to generate </span><span><strong style="color:#000">wind and solar energy could grow from 14% to 39%</strong></span><span><strong style="color:#000"><sup style="line-height: 16px;">1</sup></strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

</span>

</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Powered by Fidelity’s active management insights and expertise, The Fidelity Climate Action Fund can help you approach opportunities in the green transition with confidence.</p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/key-performance-indicators?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/key-performance-indicators?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="House boats in California " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/e140e58a87d1f74bf8c07a838a94fe69ff03f278-1024x636.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>JOSH EDELSON/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Californians used <a href="https://calmatters.org/environment/drought-2021/2021/09/california-drought-conservation/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just 1.8% less water</a> at home in July than a year before, despite extreme (or worse) drought conditions covering almost 90% of the state. Gov. Gavin Newsom had urged residents to cut domestic water use by 15% in early July.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “I just think it’s time for some of our dearest friends around the world to prenez un grip about this and donnez-moi un break.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">British Prime Minister Boris Johnson engaged in some <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-22/johnson-says-time-for-france-to-get-a-grip-on-submarine-spat?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">light mocking</a> of France after the country got snubbed from a nuclear submarine pact among the US, UK, and Australia. Pardon your French, Mr. Johnson.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>San Francisco’s bizarre, costly quest for the perfect trash can. (<a href="https://missionlocal.org/2021/09/san-francisco-garbage-can-designer?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mission Local</a>)</p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/restaurant-tech-provider-toast-jumps-over-60-in-first-day-of-trading?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Investors Raise a Glass to Toast
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/restaurant-tech-provider-toast-jumps-over-60-in-first-day-of-trading?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Toast ad on the NYSE" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/36a7f025c941f5e68829649db0e2b520afeb0bf4-720x480.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Toast</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Toast, the restaurant tech startup, <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/toast-stock-pops-60-in-ipo-debut-11632326153?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped about 56%</a> in its IPO yesterday to close at a $36 billion valuation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chances are you’ve put your card into one of Toast’s readers to pay for your fried ravioli, because its products are used at 48,000+ restaurants around the country. That’s on the front end...but on the back end, Toast also provides management software so restaurants can digitally track orders and operate delivery networks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It wasn’t always champagne and stock exchange.</strong> The onset of Covid-19 had Toast looking...well...like toast. Within two months of the start of the pandemic, the company laid off or furloughed half of its employees and revenue plummeted 80%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But when restaurants had to pivot to contactless <em>everything</em>, Toast was there, lurking in the walk-in freezer. And after powering through 2020, it’s currently riding the dining-out wave: Annual recurring revenue climbed 118% last quarter.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>You've made it past Hump Day, so <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/brew-mini-newcomer?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">solving this mini puzzle</a> should be no problem.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than the excitement for a couple’s costume. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Samuel Adams' latest potent beer is </span><span><a href="https://www.upi.com/Odd_News/2021/09/20/Samuel-Adams-Utopias-beer-illegal-15-states/7301632163091/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">illegal</a></span><span> in 15 states"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"With natural gas prices skyrocketing in Europe, one UK man </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/l2Sqi34XK8Es4gBG0/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47r30hdbldnnv03ua2r6blz4c7k3emz3j4ad3mn2i6&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sees gold</a></span><span> in bottled flatulence."</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Tim Cook says employees who </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/22/22687747/tim-cook-employee-leak-memos-do-not-belong-at-apple?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">leak memos</a></span><span> do not belong at Apple, according to leaked memo"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Rwandan court finds </span><span><em>Hotel Rwanda</em></span><span> film hero </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/rwanda-court-rule-case-rusesabagina-hero-hotel-rwanda-2021-09-20/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guilty</a></span><span> in terrorism case"</span>
</li>
</ol>
</div>
</td>
</tr>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/the-evergrande-crisis-reflects-greater-rot-in-china-s-real-estate-sector?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nChina's Grande Real Estate Problems \n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/22/the-evergrande-crisis-reflects-greater-rot-in-china-s-real-estate-sector?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Apartment building \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/11ece882e08206be2409b55feae994b3c621a941-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe business world has been captivated by the slow-moving train wreck that is Evergrande, a massive Chinese real estate developer that’s buried up to its penthouse in debt. Investors have feared that because of Evergrande’s size and interconnectedness with other companies, its impending collapse could do its best Covid impression and spread contagion across markets.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe latest: \u003c/strong\u003eEvergrande was able to \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-evergrande-inches-close-default-deadline-investors-wait-2021-09-21/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emake an interest payment\u003c/a\u003e on a domestic bond yesterday, but the bigger question is whether it’ll be able to settle a $83.5 million bill due today. If it can’t pay up in 30 days, it could default, which might cascade across the global economy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy is it a big deal?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause in China, real estate is the biggest game in town, and the town is pretty big—China is the world’s second-largest economy. In China, real estate contributes a mind-boggling \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/ea1b79bf-cbe3-41d9-91da-0a1ba692309f?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e29% of GDP\u003c/a\u003e (compared to 6.2% in the US in 2018). Building has literally built China into the superpower it is today.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut thanks to super-low borrowing costs, the Chinese property sector has been feasting on empty calories, leading to astronomical debt loads ($300+ billion, in the case of Evergrande) and a chronic oversupply of housing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThere is enough empty property in China to house more than 90 million people, according to the Rhodium Group’s Logan Wright. The entire population of France, Germany, Italy, the UK, or Canada could easily fit into those empty apartments.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gn1egrjMoD8\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eviral video\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from last month shows 15 unfinished high-rise apartment buildings getting demolished in a matter of seconds.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike an angry parent whose credit card was abused by their teenager, China’s government has recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/c1144ffe-30f9-41d3-b033-bb82eca258b4?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etaken steps\u003c/a\u003e to limit the amount of debt that property developers can take on. Letting Evergrande implode would show that President Xi Jinping is serious about this crackdown.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSome observers have compared Evergrande’s woes to the epic collapse of the investment bank Lehman Brothers during the 2008 financial crisis. But \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/0bf52d39-fd42-408f-aa85-52a4135de312?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eother experts\u003c/a\u003e say this isn’t a Lehman Brothers moment—it could be worse, if you view China’s gargantuan real estate sector as rotten to the core.\u003cem\u003e—NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe celebrated the first day of fall with six gallons of chili for dinner; Robinhood celebrated by \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/22/robinhood-to-launch-cryptocurrency-wallets-as-bitcoin-becomes-bigger-part-of-business.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannouncing\u003c/a\u003e the rollout of a crypto wallet. The wallet will be available for a small test group in the next few weeks, and then to the rest of its users next year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is a crypto wallet?\u003c/strong\u003e Just like regular wallets store dollars, crypto wallets are where you store your cryptocurrency. They make it possible to spend crypto like other forms of money and buy things like NFTs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCan’t you buy crypto on Robinhood already? \u003c/strong\u003eKinda, in the sense that you can \u003cem\u003ebuy \u003c/em\u003esome cryptocurrencies, like bitcoin and ethereum, but you \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/22/22686377/robinhood-crypto-wallet-currency-bitcoin-ethereum?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edon’t \u003cem\u003eown \u003c/em\u003ethem\u003c/a\u003e. When you buy crypto on Robinhood, the company buys it and then stores it in its own wallet—which means users can’t transfer it out of the app to spend on their favorite CryptoPunk. Hardcore crypto people have complained that this defeats the entire purpose of crypto\u003cem\u003ecurrency.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eRobinhood’s going full laser eyes. In its latest \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/18/robinhood-extends-relationship-individual-traders-using-says-platform?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eearnings report\u003c/a\u003e, the company said crypto made up over half of its transaction-based Q2 revenue. While there are still some limitations to its wallet, Robinhood is building the bridge for the crypto-curious into the deeper ecosystem.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNetflix has acquired the rights to all of Roald Dahl’s works, including \u003cem\u003eMatilda\u003c/em\u003e, \u003cem\u003eCharlie and the Chocolate Factory\u003c/em\u003e, and other tales that kept you up at night as a kid (remember “the Chokey”?). Reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/c2067f6f-1e39-4dc1-9ef3-9daf82c4c416?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eringing in\u003c/a\u003e at over $680 million, it’s among the biggest acquisitions Netflix has made over the past decade.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe deal expands on a 2018 partnership Netflix made for 16 Dahl licenses, which allowed it to start working on several animated series, plus a \u003cem\u003eMatilda the Musical\u003c/em\u003e adaptation. Now, Netflix’s ambitions for Dahl’s stories are bigger than the Giant Peach and include games, live theater, products, and more.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLess than a year ago, the Dahl estate publicly apologized for antisemitic comments the author made. To make amends, part of this sale’s proceeds will create a charitable fund focused on “children’s health, anti-hate, and anti-racism.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe competition to chill with you is fierce. Netflix is still the largest streaming service in the world with 209 million subscribers, but competitors are \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/22/netflix-buys-roald-dahl-catalog.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecatching up\u003c/a\u003e—especially Disney+, which launched less than two years ago but already has 116 million subscribers. Dahl’s trove of kids content could help Netflix keep its edge over Disney...and all the other streamers beefing up their catalogs.—\u003cem\u003eJW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
